title: The cost price of 100 mangoes is equal to the selling price of 80 mangoes. What is the percentage profit? - Quora

response.answer_text: The cost price of 100 mangoes is equal to the selling price of 80 mangoes. What is the percentage profit? Cost price of 100 mangoes = Selling price of 80 mangoesLet x = cost price of one mangoLet y = selling price of one mango100x = 80yy = 1.25x% profit in this problem refers to gross margin (GM)GM = (y-x)/yGM = (1.25x-x)/1.25xGM = 0.20 or 20%

Let C be the cost price per mango and S the selling price per mango. Given,100C=80S	C=80S/100=0.8S	Cost price of 80 mangoes sold =80*0.8 S=64 S Profit on sale of 80 mangoes =80S-64S=16S Percentage of profit =(16S/64S)*100=25%
